entities.name: wand
entities.description: The wand is mentioned as the one that did something when Harry was chasing someone. The text does not specify what exactly happened, but it implies that the wand's actions were unexpected or unusual.

entities.name: ollivander

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story and is mentioned as someone who is chasing someone with his wand. He is also mentioned as having a conversation with Hermione about his wand's actions.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is mentioned as being behind Harry's back, exchanging skeptical looks with Hermione in the mirror.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as having a conversation with Harry about his wand's actions. She is also mentioned as exchanging skeptical looks with Ron behind Harry's back.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as someone who knows what really happened with the wand. The text does not provide more information about Voldemort's role or relationship to Harry.

relationships.description: Harry owns the wand, which is implied by his ability to use it and his concern for its actions.
Voldemort knows what really happened with the wand, as mentioned in the conversation between Harry and Hermione.
Harry is arguing with Hermione about his wand's actions. The text describes their conversation as tense and confrontational.
Ron and Hermione are exchanging skeptical looks behind Harry's back, implying that they do not believe his story about the wand.
